definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: And the king said unto her, What aileth thee?
sentences.chinese: 王问妇人说，你有什么苦处。

sentences.english: She decided to level with him about her own sufferings.
sentences.chinese: 她决定坦率地和他讲自己的苦处。

sentences.english: You don't know how they suffered as disaster victims.
sentences.chinese: 你可不知道灾民的苦处。

sentences.english: If you need a sympathetic ear, I am here.
sentences.chinese: 如果你需要谁倾听你的苦处，我在这儿呢。

sentences.english: Tibetan fierce, hide, all is troubling land.
Hey, dude, you suffering in where?
sentences.chinese: 哎，伙计，你的苦处在哪里。

sentences.english: I can only express the hope that my readers will understand my difficult position, and will be indulgent;
sentences.chinese: 我只希望读者能够理解我的立场及苦处，多多包涵。

sentences.english: This hardship is easy to think of as a wife in a large family.
sentences.chinese: 在大家庭里做媳妇，这苦处是不难想到的。

sentences.english: On the way back, we talked about the pleasure of the country people and the pain of the farmers.
sentences.chinese: 在归途中，我们讨论到只在乡下的快乐和农夫的苦处。

sentences.english: He recited his own sufferings at full length.
sentences.chinese: 他详尽地叙述了自己的苦处。

definition: sinuous/devious/full details of a story/to stoop
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: bitter water (e.g. mineral water containing sulfates)/suffering/digestive fluids rising from stomach to the mouth/fig. bitter complaint
a secret/sth best not told to anyone/confidential information
to feel wronged/to cause sb to feel wronged/grievance
to lodge under another person's roof (idiom); to live relying on sb else's charity
